        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            								<j:set var="readOnlyMode" value="${permission.readonly}"/>
          
          
            
            								<f:checkbox title="${permission.name}" checked="${permission.granted}" />
          
          
            
            								<f:checkbox title="${permission.name}" checked="${permission.granted}"  readonly="${permission.readonly}"/>
          
      
    
    
  

does not work?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -14,7 +14,8 @@

 						<j:forEach var="permission" items="${effectivePermissions}">
 							<f:entry field="${permission.formName}">
-								<kube:checkbox title="${permission.name}" checked="${permission.granted}" readonly="${permission.readonly}"/>
+								<j:set var="readOnlyMode" value="${permission.readonly}"/>
+								<f:checkbox title="${permission.name}" checked="${permission.granted}" />

nodes.bodyText:
That only prevents clicking through JavaScript it doesn’t set the standard DOM property for it and it doesn’t change the UI to show they can’t click it.
At least from reading the code I haven’t tried it...

nodes.bodyText: Looks like I was confusing readonly, old, with readOnlyMode introduced in jenkinsci/jenkins#4506. It seems the latter is not an attribute but an (undocumented?) dynamically-scoped variable.

nodes.bodyText: I am just guessing someone trying to figure out how to make a checkbox read-only is going to look at the documentation for the attribute named readonly, so put it there.
